edu.mines.jtk.interp
Class PolyTrend2

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.interp.PolyTrend2

public class PolyTrend2
extends java.lang.Object

A low-order polynomial trend in scattered data f(x1,x2). The trend is computed by least-squares fitting of the scattered data values. This class enables the computed trend to be easily removed from scattered data and restored to interpolated data.

Version:
2010.01.17
Author:
Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

Constructor Detail

PolyTrend2

public PolyTrend2(int order,
                  float[] f,
                  float[] x1,
                  float[] x2)
Constructs a trend with specified scattered samples. The specified arrays are referenced; not copied.

If insufficient samples are available for the specified order, then a fit is performed with a polynomial of lower order than that specified. Note that an order zero (constant) polynomial fit is always possible when at least one sample is specified.

Parameters:
order - order of polynomial; must be 0, 1, or 2.
f - array of sample values f(x1,x2).
x1 - array of sample x1 coordinates.
x2 - array of sample x2 coordinates.
Method Detail

setSamples

public void setSamples(float[] f,
                       float[] x1,
                       float[] x2)
Sets the known (scattered) samples to be fit. The specified arrays are referenced, not copied.

Parameters:
f - array of sample values f(x1,x2).
x1 - array of sample x1 coordinates.
x2 - array of sample x2 coordinates.

detrend

public void detrend()
Removes this trend from its referenced scattered sample values. Modifies values in the array f referenced by this trend.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the trend has already been removed.

restore

public void restore()
Restores this trend to its referenced scattered sample valuess. Modifies values in the array f referenced by this trend.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the trend has not yet been removed.

Removes this trend from the specified sample.

x2 - the sample x2 coordinate.
Returns:
the sample value with trend removed.
